suggestedNewContent.title: Common Errors When Starting Your App
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Cover: 1) Missing import statement error and how to fix it, 2) Typos in widget names (case sensitivity), 3) Missing commas between properties, 4) Unbalanced parentheses in nested widgets, 5) Red screen of death and how to read error messages

suggestedNewContent.title: Hot Reload: Your Development Superpower
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain how Flutter's hot reload works, why you don't need to restart the app for most changes, and when you DO need to do a full restart (hot restart). This is a key Flutter advantage that should be introduced early.

suggestedNewContent.title: What is Material Design?
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Brief explanation of Material Design as Google's design language, why Flutter uses it by default, and mention that Cupertino exists for iOS-style apps. Helps learners understand why it's called 'MaterialApp'.

suggestedNewContent.title: Adding Async Initialization (Preview)
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show a commented example of WidgetsFlutterBinding.ensureInitialized() usage for Firebase or other plugins. Mark as 'you'll use this later' to plant the seed without overwhelming beginners.

suggestedNewContent.title: Understanding Import Statements
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain the structure of 'package:flutter/material.dart' - what 'package' means, what 'flutter' refers to, and why we need 'material.dart' specifically. Connect to the toolbox analogy already used.

summary: The lesson provides a solid introduction to Flutter app structure with good analogies (LEGO pieces, video game start button) and clear explanations of main(), runApp(), and the widget tree concept. Code examples are accurate for current Flutter. Main issues: 1) Challenge content needs significant revision (hints and common mistakes are mismatched to lesson content), 2) Missing WARNING section for common beginner errors, 3) Could benefit from Material Design and hot reload explanations, 4) Some pedagogical gaps around import statements and property naming conventions. The core technical content is accurate and well-structured for beginners.
